description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6uvui","text":"This protocol is meant to distribute reactive(s) (i.e bacterial culture media) into final 96-well plates with a single channel pipette and then transfer culture samples from source plate(s) to these plates with a multi-channel pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19c1g","text":"In our laboratory, this protocol has been used as part of the \"High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon insertion library variants\" also available in protocols.io to prepare cultures plates to perform a subsequent counter-selection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9lk1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk7hg","text":"To run this protocol a python script in LAP format for an Opentrons OT-2 robot and an excel file with variables  such as culture volume, transfer volume etc... This protocol provides a set of instructions or description of the LAP repository entry LAP-CellMediaInoculation-OT2-2.0.0. You can find the script and complementary information for this specific version of the protocol in this LAP entry link and GitHub link to LAP entry documents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":248,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":227,"length":14},{"key":1,"offset":388,"length":14},{"key":2,"offset":407,"length":34}],"data":{}},{"key":"12ukd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvdaq","text":"The are added to GeneralVariables sheet: Change Tip In Media Distribution, Change Tip In Sample Transfer, Position Transfer Sample, Touch Tip After Transferring Sample, Touch Tip In Distribution Mixing.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49},{"style":"italic","offset":51,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":30},{"style":"italic","offset":115,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":142,"length":35},{"style":"italic","offset":179,"length":31},{"style":"italic","offset":212,"length":41},{"style":"italic","offset":255,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":289,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87qc7","text":"Change guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bu231","text":"This protocol was run in a python 3.7.1, OT App Software Version 7.0.2 and opentrons API level version 2.14 in a Linux 4.14.74 system (these are the OT-2 specifications). In the script several packages are used:  pandas (0.25.3), openpyxl (3.1.2), math, random","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jskb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0kih","text":"It has been tested with cultures from Pseudomonas putida KT2440 as part of the High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon library variants. LB and M9-citrate media with either kanamycin, gentamicin, streptomycin or ampicillin haven been successfully run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mjqt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ang1","text":"The maximum number of 96-well final plates per run given 1 source plate, 2 different types of tip racks (with the replacement of the tip rack set as True) is 7 final plates (use 1 falcon tube rack and 2 tip racks)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":158,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cuc14","text":"We have 2 source plates, only with 96 samples and the other with 50.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tegi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t2gq","text":"With the first source plate we want to create 1 plate with only samples from the source plate.
